intro.text: You must be the new student!It is wonderful to finally meet you on these campus grounds!

intro 2.text: The name is Pompom.Tour guide and mascot of this place.

intro 3.text: I am sure you have some questions.Like why is a cat talking?

intro 4.text: Simply raise your hand and ask away!

choices.text: Honestly thought you were a bunny
choices.label: intro 4.1

intro 5.2.text: I'd like to ask you a few questions to better understand you and your expectations

intro 5.3.text: Post secondary institutions have a different approach to course material as compared to high school and below...

intro 5.4.text: So how confident are you to be able to understand the complex material you will be receiving?

intro 5.5.text: Said materials include assignments and tests. How is your confidence on that?

intro 5.7.text: I look forward to improving these expectations

intro 9.text: I was not gifted with a walking animation.But don't worry,I will not be doing that for every action I do

intro 11.text: Here , You will taught the necessary preparations for attending a post secondary institute

intro 12.text: In this particular tour with me,we will be covering...

intro 13.text: The concept of Spirals,Mindsets,and a summary of some of modules you will be learning.

intro 14.text: Feel free to tell me which one do you want to start on first

Something else.text: What else do you wanna talk about?

Spirals 1.text: Being a cat has its benefits of being able to observe all kinds of students throughout the campus

Spirals 2.text: Mostly through the windows as animals are not allowed inside of facilities

Spirals 3.text: And out of concern for those with cat allergies.

Spirals 5.text: I've seen professors,and the like, give challenges and tasks to students.

Spirals 7.text: The individual approach and outcome to a task are whats known as [shake rate=10 level=5]Spirals[/shake]

Spirals 8.text: And there are one of two ways this usually goes for the student

Spirals 9.text: Would you like to try and see which one you fall under?

Spiral Quiz 2.text: When succesful at a task what do you do {next}?

choices.text: Self Criticize for future improvements (+1 Str)
choices.label: Spiral Quiz 3

choices.text: Move on to the {next} task (+1 Suc)
choices.label: Spiral Quiz 3

Spiral Quiz 3.text: Do you find yourself struggling before the task is completed?

Spiral Quiz 4.text: At what point do you feel like stopping your work?

choices.text: When a streak of success ends (+1 Suc)
choices.label: Spiral Quiz 5

choices.text: I find a problem unsolvable (+1 Str)
choices.label: Spiral Quiz 5

Spiral Quiz 5.text: It appears that during your work periods you find yourself in a...

Spiral Quiz 7.text:
-Work in Progress dialogue-
Work at a later time.

Mindsets 1.text: The concept of the "Mindset" refers to the way one thinks about their own talents and abilities.

Mindsets 3.text: If you try hard enough, will you be able to understand the course material?

Mindsets 4.text: Your answer to this particular question and any other questions like it, will determine where you stand in terms of mindsets.

Mindsets 5.text: You see mindsets fall under a continuum of either "Fixed" or "Growth" mindsets.

Mindsets 6.text: Take a look at that student who is most definitely here right now in front of me! What do you think they're doing?

Mindsets Frisbee 1.text: I recognize him! That's Kilograw. Resident boomerang athlete of our university.

Mindsets Frisbee 1.1.text: Capable of throwing boomerangs as fast as the world's fastest baseball pitch.

Catch 1.text: *You catch the boomerang with absolute confidence...on the outside*

Catch 1.1.text: The sudden stop of the thrown boomerang resulted in a gust of strong winds towards you. Your face looks like a loose latex mask.

Dodge 1.text: You and Pompom duck to avoid the boomerang.

Dodge 3.text: The boomerang passes by your side with winds of what felt like jet engines!

Dodge 6.text: Hold on! I'm way shorter than the boomerang's elevation! Why did I even duck?!

Sacrifice 1.text: You fling Pompom onto boomerang height.

Sacrifice 1.1.text: Pompom's shade turns murky black. Every bit of fur on him had suddenly hardened into metal. And his eyes suddenly narrowed deadset onto the incoming projectile.

Sacrifice 2.text: Pompom kicks the boomerang in lightning speed and turns towards you...

Save 2.text: You push Pompom out of the way! He felt heavier for some reason...

Save 3.text: You took the full force of the boomerang. You got knocked onto the grass field.

Save 5.text: Wow you took that like a champ!

Growth Mindsets 1.text: Kilograw here is a psychology major with an athletic career on the side.

Growth Mindsets 2.text: And that amount of work and dedication is tough.

Growth Mindsets 3.text: Like really tough! You gotta have the guts y'hear?

Growth Mindsets 4.text: The guts to do this do not come out straight away.

Growth Mindsets 5.text: The [b]Growth Mindset[/b] is something Kilograw had to develop himself.

Growth Mindsets 6.text: Individuals with the [b]growth mindsets[/b] have a thought process in which their performance quality of a task is something to be nurtured and practiced regularly.

Growth Mindsets 7.text: The lack of such a routine is believed to be a cause for their natural abilities to stagnate.

Growth Mindsets 8.text: And "Failure" is just a means of learning further and is an opporunity to either pivot or restrategize the approach. And the same can be said for constructive feedback

Growth Mindsets 9.text: Kilograw had been practicing his boomerang throw every single day on that one spot.

Growth Mindsets 10.text: The grass that he stands on had actually died because his feet were on those two spots that often!

Growth Mindsets 11.text: I've known him long enough to know that he would take on the hardest challenges his professors had to throw at him for extra credit.

Growth Mindsets 13.text: Not because he needed more things to fill his portfolio or his accomplishments.

Growth Mindsets 14.text: Although that is a HUGE plus.

Growth Mindsets 15.text: He does it for his own self improvement.

Growth Mindsets 16.text: My past conversations with him showed that he was not always like this.

choices.text: Don't you need to "fall" into the growth mindset?
choices.label: Growth Mindsets 17

Kilograw 1.text: As his friend, I could not give details. Perhaps you should ask him in the future.

Kilograw 2.text: I am certain he would be open about it! You'll know where to find him anyways.

Growth Mindsets 17.text: Although it is true that once you learn about the different mindsets you will self-assess yourself and have you falling into one end of the continuum.

Growth Mindsets 18.text: There is a big possibility that your mindset may change over time...

Growth Mindsets 20.text: And so even getting towards the Growth Mindset will require your own efforts and decision to improve at some point in your life.

Growth Mindsets 21.text: A "Grown" Growth Mindset requires a spark from an even smaller Growth Mindset.

Growth Mindsets 22.text: And I believe in you and your potential to make it there one day. Like getting the good grades and such!

Growth Mindsets 23.text: Do you think so as well?

Growth Mindsets 23.1.text: Do you believe that you will receive excellent grades in post secondary?

Growth Mindsets 24.text:
That covers the topic of the Growth Mindset. Let's go observe another student! 
(YOU RECEIVED THE GROWTH MINDSET KEYWORD!)

want to improve 4.text:
It refers to the workflow of how one approaches
challenges and tasks.

want to improve 5.text: When given a challenge, how do you approach it?

choices.text: I struggle quite greatly with the given task
choices.label: struggle 1

choices.text: I keep going until I lose success

struggle 1.text:
And i assume the more you struggle with said task
the more you find yourself in doubt and criticism?
which in term leads to GREATER doubt
and HARSHER criticisms in your own work.

struggle 2.text:
And in the end, you find yourself avoiding said challenge
as it swallows you whole in a cycle of frustration.

struggle 3.text:
This is known as a
"Struggle Spiral"

choices.text: Spirals as in plural, what's the other?
choices.label: success 1

success 1.text:
Although it is good to succeed at the task
over and over again.

success 2.text:
We fuel our motivation as long as success is met.
Sometimes leading us into more challenges and into new activities.

success 4.text:
The streak is lost and the motivation is gone
your very foundations of improvement are crumbled
all because you had one instance of failure.

success 5.text:
This is what's known as the
"Success Spiral"

choices.text: Spirals as in plural, what's the other?
choices.label: struggle 1

spirals.text:
Both spirals showcase how we can easily fall victim
to a mindset that can greatly reduce in productivity
which will hinder you from thriving in
a post-secondary environment.

choices.text: Then what does it take to improve?
choices.label: what it takes 1

choices.text: Seriously, do i have to be immortal?
choices.label: what it takes 1

what it takes 1.text:
Well, there are multiple things to consider...
Though it may not be the exact solutions
These are simply thoughts for guidance.

what it takes 4.text: The process of learning something new is not linear.

what it takes 5.text:
Experimenting on new ideas is a part of the learning process
when approaching such material, it is important to adopt
and approach as you gather info, process, and strategize
your way through the challenges that comes with ADHD and LD.

what it takes 6.text:
The key is to remind yourself that experimentation
is all a part of the learning process.

what it takes 7.text:
Failure is necessary
to bring you closer to your goal.
 A malleable yellow dog once told me that.

what it takes 9.text:
When trying new things, sometimes said thing
looks deceptively simple and that it is a challenge to implement

what it takes 10.text:
And with certain strategies of approach being quite popular.
I would understand why one were to get frustrated
when the popular strategy is done with difficulty
while everyone else seems to do it with ease.

what it takes 11.text:
Remember that experimentation is all a part of the process
with each failure, or success, it will always bring you closer
to your goals.

what it takes 12.text:
It is hardly a waste of time as what does NOT work
helps you on what works and what does not work

what it takes 13.text: "Past Performance Does Not Equal Future Performance"

what it takes 14.text: Your past should never define you

what it takes 15.text:
Though you may fail to the point of giving up,
those past mistakes are meant to be learnt from
and so you must move on.

what it takes 16.text: Consider learning these to work towards your future goals...

what it takes 18.text:
...Bounce back from failure
and user the experience to course correct...

what it takes 19.text:
...address your challenges,
including ADHD and Learning Disabilities,
to make your life easier...

what it takes 20.text: ...access the resources you need to chart a new course

what it takes 21.text:
There is always something to learn.
NO matter the failures.

what it takes 23.text:
After experimenting what does and does not work,
it is best to be kind to yourself and show yourself
that no progress is truly linear and struggle is natural

immortal 1.text:
No
No, you don't
as limited human life is compared to mine.

immortal 2.text:
Your own life is long enough and worth spending
as much time to think about what exactly it is
you find to be the best route for you to grow
and this journey is meant for you to realize that you can grow.
Not to be fixed unto one spot.

conclusion.text:
When you can approach your learning with curiosity
your chances of success will increase
and will help motivate you to figure out
the best path forward for you

conclusion 2.text: I welcome you to this journey.
